section.title: Past time words: already, just, and never ... before
section.sectiontitle: We use had + already + past participle if we want to emphasise that something happened before a particular time.
section.text1a: When we got there, the film <b>had already started.
section.sectiontitle2: We use had + just + past participle if we want to emphasise that something happened only a short time before.
section.text3a: Unfortunately, the train had just left when we got to the station.

section.title: Past time words: already, just, and never ... before
section.sectiontitle: We use had + never + past participle ... before to say that it was the first time something happened.
section.text1a: It was a very interesting meal. I had never eaten Mexican food before.
section.sectiontitle2: We also often use before and not before with the Past perfect.
section.text3a: I liked Rome. I'd been there three times before.
section.text4a: I hadn't done snowboarding before and I loved it.
